YAMIASSU

Welcome to Yamiassu, a framework oriented to variables developed by APO Softworks to enhance content creation and edition at runtime.

We welcome you to our framework. Here we develop a better way to build your applications in a record time and make it fully customizable to any need you may have. Yamiassu comes from the brazilian indigenous language Tupi-Guarani, it means the great(a√ßu/assu) night(yami). Hence the theme of the style we created. You will find the conventions used by our team to make the best out of everything provided.

About our philosophy

We highly believe that less is more and that you shouldn't need to steep your eyes when using an application during the night. So sit back and enjoy the night sky.

Our color system

We modularly integrated the colors that are in the framework with the content, so they are not actually within each of the components. So they are easy to toggle and do not exponentially scale the size of the css file. There are two types of pre-configured colors that you can use: background and line. They both can be toggled interactive, that would enable you to place them on buttons or anything else that should interact with user events.

Grid system

Our grid system is based on a 12-column (or called blocks by us) grid. Totally changeable in the scss configuration. Sadly, due to css limitations, we cannot do it runtime. But complains aside, we let you customize your own responsivity rules.

Blocks

Those are the building blocks (pun not intended) of every application.

Pushs

When you need spacing between your blocks, you may use pushs to do that. They Fall under the same rules as blocks, 12 columns.

.push-6 .block-6
.block-4
.block-4 .push-4

Shelves

A shelf is a row that won't let your children mix with other shelves. They are absolute on in it's line.

.block-3
.block-3

Stands

A stand is a display stand, intended to make sure the content is always displayed on the middle of the screen.

A block without a stand
A block with a stand

Responsive Grid System

We follow the idea that the grid size should scale accordlying, and snap it to fill for full size after a threshold is fullfield.

Alert

Alert notifications are the ones that appear in the screen as a modal and block the use of the rest of the content while opened. Click here to toggle a full example of the alert notification. Attention: don't confuse alert notifications with modals, they are for different purposes and ends.
